intro: Lagoseris sancta subsp. bifida, commonly known as the bifid sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are narrow and often have a bifurcated or forked appearance, giving rise to its subspecies name. The flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters, and it produces seeds that are dispersed by wind.
